intro: Bolivihanburya boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian holly, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces woody capsules containing numerous seeds. Bolivihanburya boliviana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry climates.
